channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump's withdrawn nominees latest in a long line of Cabinet members who never were
item.description: Many presidents face failed Cabinet picks so when former Rep. Matt Gaetz withdrew from consideration for President-elect Donald Trump's Cabinet, it wasn't unprecedented, though Trump's style has been.
item.content:encoded:
Many presidents face failed Cabinet picks so when former Rep. Matt Gaetz withdrew from consideration for President-elect Donald Trump's Cabinet, it wasn't unprecedented, though Trump's style has been.

(Image credit: BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: One family thought they had left Syria forever. After Assad's fall, they plan to return
item.description: Rehab Alkadi and her husband, Feras, fled Syria's war with their young son in 2013. They and other Syrian refugees in the U.S. are now hopeful for their country's future, even as uncertainty remains.
item.content:encoded:
Rehab Alkadi and her husband, Feras, fled Syria's war with their young son in 2013. They and other Syrian refugees in the U.S. are now hopeful for their country's future, even as uncertainty remains.

(Image credit: Rehab Alkadi)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Dreaming of a Black Utopia in Trump's America
item.description:
In his new book, The Black Utopians, author Aaron Robinson tells the story of how Black folks have created many different versions of utopian communities throughout history — and why those communities tend to be especially meaningful during times of political tension and racial unrest.

We want to hear from our listeners about what you like about Code Switch and how we could do better. Please tell us what you think by taking our short survey, and thank you!
item.content:encoded:
In his new book, The Black Utopians, author Aaron Robinson tells the story of how Black folks have created many different versions of utopian communities throughout history — and why those communities tend to be especially meaningful during times of political tension and racial unrest.

We want to hear from our listeners about what you like about Code Switch and how we could do better. Please tell us what you think by taking our short survey, and thank you!
item.dc:creator: B.A. Parker

item.title: Through 'The Loss Mother's Stone,' mothers share their grief from losing a child to stillbirth
item.description: Through her work, photographer Nancy Borowick says she hopes to draw awareness to women's stories, educate Americans and destigmatize the conversation that occurs between doctors and patients.
item.content:encoded:
Through her work, photographer Nancy Borowick says she hopes to draw awareness to women's stories, educate Americans and destigmatize the conversation that occurs between doctors and patients.

(Image credit: Nancy Borowick)
item.dc:creator: Nancy Borowick

item.title: GM to retreat from robotaxis and stop funding its Cruise autonomous vehicle unit
item.description: The automaker will focus on development of partially automated driver-assist systems for personal vehicles like its Super Cruise, which allows drivers to take their hands off the steering wheel.
item.content:encoded:
The automaker will focus on development of partially automated driver-assist systems for personal vehicles like its Super Cruise, which allows drivers to take their hands off the steering wheel.

(Image credit: Paul Sancya)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Bankruptcy judge rejects The Onion's bid for Infowars
item.description: The bidder that lost last month's auction of conspiracy theorist Alex Jones' assets had complained that the process was rigged and "fatally flawed."
item.content:encoded:
The bidder that lost last month's auction of conspiracy theorist Alex Jones' assets had complained that the process was rigged and "fatally flawed."

(Image credit: Joe Buglewicz)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: The Mood Inside Syria
item.description:
For the first time in a generation, Syrians are no longer living under the regime of a brutal dictator. Our reporter travelled from Lebanon to Syria's capital, Damascus, talking to Syrians along the way and tells us how people are adjusting to their new reality.

Sign up for State of the World+ to listen sponsor-free and support the work of NPR journalists. Visit plus.npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
For the first time in a generation, Syrians are no longer living under the regime of a brutal dictator. Our reporter travelled from Lebanon to Syria's capital, Damascus, talking to Syrians along the way and tells us how people are adjusting to their new reality.

Sign up for State of the World+ to listen sponsor-free and support the work of NPR journalists. Visit plus.npr.org.

(Image credit: Omar Haj Kadour)
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Monarch butterflies will get federal protections as a threatened species
item.description: U.S. officials decided to extend protections to monarch butterflies after warnings from environmentalists that populations are shrinking and the beloved pollinator may not survive climate change.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. officials decided to extend protections to monarch butterflies after warnings from environmentalists that populations are shrinking and the beloved pollinator may not survive climate change.

(Image credit: Sue Ogrocki)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Kroger and Albertsons grocery megamerger halted by two courts
item.description: Two rulings — in federal and state courts — make it increasingly likely that Kroger might abandon its $24.6 billion plan to buy Albertsons. The merger aimed to combine two of America's largest supermarket chains.
item.content:encoded:
Two rulings — in federal and state courts — make it increasingly likely that Kroger might abandon its $24.6 billion plan to buy Albertsons. The merger aimed to combine two of America's largest supermarket chains.

(Image credit: Al Behrman/AP)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: An Afghan museum that buried its artifacts after Taliban takeover is reborn online
item.description: The Afghanistan Memory Home Museum shares details and belongings from those who've died in conflict. It shut its doors when the Taliban took power, buried much of its collection — but has now reemerged.
item.content:encoded:
The Afghanistan Memory Home Museum shares details and belongings from those who've died in conflict. It shut its doors when the Taliban took power, buried much of its collection — but has now reemerged.

(Image credit: Afghanistan Memory Home)
item.dc:creator: Ruchi Kumar
